name: Prof. Dilli Dogo, FNAMed
bio: Born in Marama town of Borno state in 1959, Professor Dilli Dogo graduated from the University of Maiduguri in 1984 with a Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery with Distinction in Medicine and Physiology. After his Housemanship and National Youth Service, he had automatic employment as Medical Research Fellow by the same University and was sponsored for postgraduate studies in Surgery. Professor Dogo is now a celebrated Professor of Surgery and Consultant Surgeon who has positively impacted humanity and society. He is a Fellow of the National Postgraduate Medical College of Nigeria, the West African College of Surgeons, the American College of Surgeons, and the International College of Surgeons among many others. He is a foundation Fellow of the Nigeria Academy of Medicine (FNAMed) and a member of the Board of Trustees. Professor Dilli Dogo rose through the ranks from Medical Research Fellow I to Professor of Surgery where he served the University in various capacities. He was Head of the Department for a long time and was Provost of the College of Medical Sciences of the University of Maiduguri in 2011. Professor Dilli Dogo also served on many management committees and was a member of the Governing Council of the University of Maiduguri from 2012-2015. He was the Endowment’s coordinator and Director of Public-Private Partnerships at the University. He was also a member of the Management Board of the University of Maiduguri Teaching Hospital for two consecutive Board sessions. He studied Laparoscopic Surgery at the University of Strasburg in France and Endoscopic urology at the University of Klinicum, Germany. Dogo was one time Chairman, of the Nigerian Association of Colleges of Medicine and Medical Sciences (NACOM) now APCOM, and at various times served on many committees of Borno State and the Nigerian Government including the Nigerian National Merit Award. He was also chairman, Faculty of Surgery and a member of Governing Board of the National Postgraduate Medical College of Nigeria. Professor Dilli Dogo was appointed as Honourable Special Adviser to Borno State Government on Health Matters between 2011 and 2019. He also served as Chairman, Faculty of Surgery National Postgraduate Medica College of Nigeria, and member of the Governing Board of the College. Professor Dilli Dogo has been active in the accreditation of Medicine and Surgery for the Medical and Dental Council of Nigeria (MDCN) and the National Universities Commission both locally and internationally and was a regular member of the Examination Board for Foreign Medical graduates. He was requested to join Nile University to assist in developing the College of Medical Sciences and within a short time made the College one of the best in Nigeria. He has published so many articles in peer-reviewed journals Nationally and Internationally. He is married and has 5 children. He is also Philanthropist
designation: Vice Chancellor Nile University of Nigeria

name: Prof. Saleh El-Yakub Abdullahi
bio: Professor Saleh El-Yakub Abdullahi is a distinguished academic with over 23 years of post-qualification teaching and research experience, coupled with 19 years of experience in the telecommunications industry. He earned his B.Sc. in Computer Science from Abubakar Tafawa-Balewa College under Ahmadu Bello University in 1987, an M.Sc. in Computer Science from the University of Lagos, and a Ph.D. in Computer Science from Queen Mary and Westfield College, University of London, in 1996. Professor Abdullahi’s extensive career in the telecommunications sector includes serving in various IT roles at the defunct Nigerian Telecommunication (NITEL) Plc and Nigerian Mobile Telecommunication (MTEL) Ltd from 1996 until 2015, when he retired as the last Managing Director/Chief Executive Officer of MTEL Ltd. His academic career began at Abubakar Tafawa-Balewa University in 1988 as a Graduate Assistant. He also served as a Lecturer at Lefke University in Cyprus (1994-1995), a Visiting Senior Lecturer/Reader at the Nigerian Defence Academy, Kaduna (2009-2018), and a Visiting Senior Lecturer/Professor at Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria (2008-2020). Professor Abdullahi joined Nile University of Nigeria, Abuja in 2011, initially as a Visiting Senior Lecturer/Associate Professor, before taking a full-time position in 2015. He served as the Head of the Computer Science Department from August to October 2015 and was the Director of Academic Planning (DAP) from November 2015 to 2023. In his role as DAP, he successfully coordinated the establishment of 65 new academic programs and the accreditation of 49 academic programs at Nile University. His research interests include Operating Systems, Programming Languages, and Software Engineering. He has published over 30 peer-reviewed articles in international and national journals and has supervised 4 Ph.D., 40 M.Sc., and numerous B.Sc. projects in Computer Science. Professor Abdullahi has also contributed two book chapters on Computer Science, further solidifying his academic credentials.

reviews.comment: Engaging lectures, but too much homework

name: Prof. Prema Kirubakaran
bio: Dr.A.Prema Kirubakaran is an Associate Professor and Head of the Department of Information Technology & Information Systems. She has 21 years of Teaching Experience and 15 years of research experience in Indian universities and other foreign universities. She has published 51 articles in National and International Journals. She has received many awards for her research work, Teaching skills, and administration abilities. She is an article reviewer of many international journals, including Springer Journals, Taylor & Francis, CSI, ICT Research Journal, AJCIS Research, and Online reviewer for Shiksha higher studies. She holds 4 Indian patents and one UK patent. She is currently working on three consultancy projects. She is a Board of Study member in various institutions. She is in the Asia and India Book of Records for her research articles. In 2023, as an editor of IoT books, her work was initiated for the Guinness world record attempt. She is a lifetime member of various technical organizations like CSI, IRA, and SDIWC. She is the editor of the Indian Journal of Science and Research. She is currently pursuing her post-doctoral fellowship in Quantum Computing.
designation: Deputy VC (Central Admin) & HOD, Information Technology & Systems

reviews.comment: Tough grader, but I learned a lot

name: Dr. Aminu Mohammadu Mai (MBBS, FWACS, FICS)
bio: Dr. Aminu Mai is an Associate Professor in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynaecology at the College of Health Sciences, Nile University of Nigeria. He graduated with an MBBS degree from the College of Medicine, University of Maiduguri, in 1983. Dr. Mai completed his residency training at the University of Benin Teaching Hospital in Benin City from 1986 to 1991, earning Membership of the National Postgraduate Medical College and Fellowship of the West African College of Surgeons in Obstetrics and Gynaecology. In 1991, Dr. Mai was appointed Lecturer I and Honorary Consultant Obstetrician & Gynaecologist at the College of Medicine, University of Maiduguri, and the University Teaching Hospital. In 1994, he received a Commonwealth Scholarship for six months of training in Assisted Reproductive Technology, Tubal Surgery, and Foetal Medicine at Hammersmith Hospital and Queen Charlotte’s Hospital in London, UK. That same year, he was nominated for the Young Gynaecologists Award by the International Federation of Gynaecology and Obstetrics (FIGO), allowing him to attend the FIGO International Congress in Montreal, Canada, and participate in a Preceptorship at Northwestern University Hospital, Ontario. In 1996, he was promoted to Senior Lecturer at the University of Maiduguri. Dr. Mai transitioned into healthcare management and administration when he was appointed the pioneer Medical Director/CEO of the Federal Medical Centre, Yola, Adamawa State, from 1998 to 2006. In 2007, he became the pioneer General Manager/CEO of the FCT Hospitals Management Board. After completing his tenure in 2020, Dr. Mai returned to academics as an Associate Professor at the College of Health Sciences, Nile University of Nigeria. Dr. Mai is a member of several professional associations, including the Nigeria Medical Association (NMA), Society of Gynaecology and Obstetrics of Nigeria (SOGON), Association for Fertility and Reproductive Health (ARFH), and the Medical & Dental Consultants Association of Nigeria (MDCAN), among others.
courses: Variations in menstrual cycle: DUB (Abnormal Uterine Bleeding)

name: Prof. Dr. Senol DANE
bio: Dr. Senol Dane graduated from Ege University, Faculty of Medicine, İzmir, Turkey, in 1986. He worked at Cinar Health Center in Diyarbakir and Mevlana Health Center in Konya, Turkey. In 1988, Dr. Dane began his career as a research assistant at Ataturk University, Medical Faculty, Department of Medical Physiology, in Erzurum, Turkey. He became a medical specialist in Medical Physiology in 1990, an assistant professor in 1991, an associate professor in 1993, and a full professor in 1998, all within the same department. Dr. Dane served on the education committee for five years at the Medical Faculty of Ataturk University. He has received multiple awards for Outstanding Scientist of the Year from Ataturk University, Fatih University, Turgut Ozal University, and Nile University of Nigeria. In 2021, he won the Best Scientist award at the Prophetic Medicine Congress in Abu Dhabi, UAE. He has been a member of the New York Academy of Science since 1997. Dr. Dane has published approximately 200 scientific papers in international top journals indexed in the Science Citation Index, with about 5,000 citations. He has also written around 50 local papers in Turkish. His international published book chapters include “Brain Injury and Cerebral Lateralization” and “Enzymes and Digestion.” Dr. Dane has received two significant grants from The Scientific and Technological Research Council of Turkey (TUBITAK): one for Voltammetry and neurotransmitters in 2006 (300,000.00 TL) and another for using Voltammetry for therapeutics in 2012 (2,000,000.00 TL). His research interests encompass Neurophysiology, Psychophysiology, Cerebral Lateralization, Sport and Exercise Physiology, and Complementary Medicine. He has investigated the relationships between cerebral lateralization and neuropsychological diseases such as Autism, Schizophrenia, and Migraine. Dr. Dane discovered novel therapeutic strategies utilizing Cerebral Lateralization, including forced unilateral nostril breathing, which significantly impacted autistic children. Dr. Dane’s research on Traditional and Complementary Medicine has revealed the health benefits of therapies such as hijamah (wet and dry cupping), reflexology, and footbath therapy. His studies have shown that wet-cupping therapy helps dispose of toxic materials, regulate sleep, and boost immunity. Reflexology studies have demonstrated positive effects on autism. Additionally, Dr. Dane has explored the effects of short- and long-term training on oxidative/antioxidative balance in animals and athletes within the field of Exercise Physiology and Oxidative Stress.
designation: Dean, Faculty of Basic Medical Sciences

name: Dr. Menizibeya Osain Welcome MD, PhD
bio: Dr. Menizibeya Osain Welcome is an Associate Professor and the Head of the Department of Human Physiology. He has established research collaboration with leading scientists across the globe, including the President and Founder of the World Scientific and Engineering Society and Academy, Athens, Greece. Dr. Welcome has earned many international awards and honors. He has served as Editor or Guest Editor in several international journals. Dr. Welcome’s research interests include psychophysiological indices and glycemic allostasis of alcohol use and related problems among young adults; brain error monitoring and processing system; cellular, molecular and neurometaplastic signatures, underlying different behavioral patterns and cerebral lateralization in normal and neurobehavioural disorders; gut epithelial and blood brain barrier dysfunction in neuroinflammatory disorders and the therapeutic role of bioactive agents; role of central sweet and bitter taste receptors in cognitive processes, brain metabolism and neuroinflammation. He has successfully published several articles in Web of Science- and Scopus- indexed journals with impact factor.

name: Prof. Goke Francis Ibironke
bio: Professor Goke Francis Ibironke is a Professor in the Department of Physiology, College of Health Sciences at Nile University of Nigeria, Abuja, Nigeria. He started work at the University of Ibadan, Nigeria in November 1988 as a Lecturer I in the Department of Physiology. He became a Reader in Physiology in 2017. He then moved to the University of Medical Sciences, Ondo, Nigeria in 2018 as a Professor of Physiology and Dean, Faculty of Basic Medical Sciences. He teaches Neuro-Physiology and other Physiology specialties to undergraduate second- and third-year (pre-clinical) medical and Physiology students. His research interests include Neuro-Physiology and the Pathophysiology of Pain. He has published over forty (40) scientific articles in national and internationally referred and reputable journals.
department: Human Physiology, (Faculty of Basic Medical Sciences, College of Health Sciences)
courses: Building Blocks (Physiology of Blood & Body Fluids)

name: Oluwatosin Imoleayo Oyeniran
bio: Oluwatosin Oyeniran is an experienced university researcher and lecturer with a demonstrated history of working in the higher education industry. He teaches physiology to undergraduates and carry out research in physiology and biomedical sciences. He possess strong educational credentials and experience spanning over six (6) years in university teaching and research. Till date, he has published over 43 scholarly articles in high-impact journals, presented his research works in over ten (10) local and international conferences, and his works have gathered over 447 Google Scholar citations globally.
courses: Introductory Physiology for Public Health Students (PHS 207)
Introductory Physiology for Physiology and Anatomy Students (PHS 203)

name: Dr. Sanni Emmanuel Oladipo
bio: Dr. Emmanuel Oladipo Sanni is a Lecturer in the Department of Hematology and Blood Transfusion, Faculty of Basic Clinical Sciences. He had his basic Medical Training MBBS at the college of Medicine, University of Ilorin. He is a member of the west African college of physician (Lab Medicine) and a fellow of the National Postgraduate Medical College of Nigeria (FMCpath; Haematology and Blood Transfusion). He is also a member of the College of Nigeria Pathologist, Nigerian Medical Association, Nigerian Society for Haematology and Blood Transfusion as well as Academy member, International Society for Thrombosis and Haemostasis. His areas of research interest are Sickle cell, General Haematology, Blood Transfusion, Haemato-Oncology and Stem cell Transplantation.

name: Prof. Boaz Adegboro
bio: Professor Boaz Adegboro is a distinguished Professor of Medical Microbiology and Immunology. He is a Harvard Fellow in Microbiology and Molecular Genetics, a Fellow of the New York Academy of Sciences, and a Foundation Fellow of the Academy of Medicine Specialties of Nigeria. He is renowned for his pioneering research on Group B Streptococcal Infections and his significant contributions to the development of Laboratory Medicine and Medical Education at both undergraduate and postgraduate levels in Nigeria. Professor Adegboro served as the editor of the *Journal of Clinical and Experimental Microbiology* from 2002 to 2020. He has held several prominent positions, including Dean of the Faculty of Health Sciences at the University of Ilorin (1996-2000), Chair of the Epidemiology Sub-Committee of the National Expert Committee on the Control of HIV/AIDS (1990-2004), President of the Nigerian Venereal Diseases Association (2000-2004), President of the Association of Pathologists of Nigeria (2000-2004), and Member of the Medical and Dental Council of Nigeria (2002-2006). In addition to his academic and professional accomplishments, Professor Adegboro is the author of several medical textbooks and novels, including *Microbiology* and *Microbiology International*. His work has left a lasting impact on medical science and education in Nigeria.
courses: Medical undergraduates: Medical Microbiology and Immunology

name: Dr. Mba Izuchukwu Nnachi
bio: Dr. Mba Izuchukwu Nnachi is a Lecturer in the department of Chemical Pathology of the faculty of Basic Clinical Sciences. He obtained his MBBS degree in 2009 and fellowship of the National Postgraduate Medical College of Nigeria in 2021. Dr. Mba’s research interests are in metabolic bone diseases, clinical and metabolic endocrinology, cardiovascular risks and nutrition. His diagnostic skill in the sphere of clinical chemistry is highly sought after in the six geopolitical zones of Nigeria. He has more than three years teaching experience.

name: Assoc. Prof. Henry Onyebutulem
bio: Dr. Onyegbutulem HC is an Associate Professor and Head of the Department of Internal Medicine at the Faculty of Clinical Sciences, College of Medicine, Nile University of Nigeria. He is the pioneer head of the Department of Internal Medicine. Previously, he was a lecturer in the Department of Internal Medicine at Bingham University, where he was also one of the pioneer staff. Dr. Onyegbutulem obtained his MBBS degree from the University of Ibadan. After completing his internship and national service, he pursued residency training in Internal Medicine at the University College Hospital (UCH), Ibadan, specializing in Endocrine, Diabetes, and Metabolic Medicine. He also holds a Master’s in HIV Medicine from the Institute of Human Virology of Nigeria (IHVN). His residency training and clinical exposure included stints at the Department of Endocrinology at Heinrich-Heine University/Hospital and the German Diabetes Institute in Düsseldorf, Carl Gustav Carus Hospital in Dresden, Germany, and the Department of Medicine at Groote Schuur Hospital in Cape Town, South Africa. Dr. Onyegbutulem received several study grants, including the Albert Reynold Fellowship, the Robert Turner Grant to the Oxford Centre for Diabetes, Endocrinology and Metabolism (OCDEM) at the University of Oxford, and the European Foundation for the Study of Diabetes Fellowship. He also attended the European Association for the Study of Diabetes/American Diabetes Association/International Diabetes Federation Advanced Postgraduate Course for the Study of Diabetes in Yaoundé, Cameroon, and Finland. He serves as the sub-editor of the Nile Journal of Health Sciences (NJHS) and is a reviewer for many other medical journals.

name: Dr. Sikirat Adetoun Sotimehin

name: Dr. Jacob Shagbaor Suemo
bio: Dr. Jacob Shagbaor Suemo is a seasoned academic with extensive training and experience in the field of Mass Communication. He holds a Ph.D. (2018), an M.Sc. (2012), and a B.Sc. (2007) in Mass Communication, all from Benue State University, Makurdi. Additionally, he earned a Diploma in Theatre Arts with distinction and an Alison Diploma in Teaching Skills for Educators. He also holds a certificate in Broadcasting and Digital Communication from Calvin College, Grand Rapids, Michigan, USA. Born on August 17, 1984, at NKST Hospital Mkar in Gboko, Benue State, Dr. Suemo began his primary education at Robert F. Kennedy Nursery & Primary School, Gboko, in 1989 and attended Government Secondary School, Makurdi, from 1995 to 2001. His academic journey culminated in a Ph.D. in Mass Communication from Benue State University in 2018. Dr. Suemo’s professional career began as a Television Presenter/Marketer with NTA Makurdi Network Station in 2005. He later worked as Editor of Pavilion Newspaper in 2007, Marketing Manager at Elrovic Media Concept (NYSC) in Benin City, Edo State, in 2008, and Manager at Benue State University FM. In 2009, he transitioned to academia as a Lecturer, starting as a Graduate Assistant and rising to Senior Lecturer. He currently serves as the Head of the Department of Mass Communication at Nile University of Nigeria, Abuja, overseeing five studios and both undergraduate and postgraduate programs. Previously, he was the Director of Communications at the World Bank Africa Centre of Excellence: Centre for Food Technology and Research. Dr. Suemo is the Chairman of the Board of Directors and CEO of the Centre for Advancing Professional Standards in Journalism and Media Studies (APSTAJOMS). He is also a registered Scholar of the African Council for Communication Education, a member of the International Communication Association, Nigerian Institute of Public Relations Practitioners, Advertisers Regulatory Council of Nigeria, Association of Communication Scholars & Professionals of Nigeria, African Council for Communication Education, Institute of Mass Communication and Information Management of Nigeria, Haggai Leadership Institute, and Nigerian Union of Journalists. He has authored over 35 peer-reviewed journal articles, five book chapters, and three books. Dr. Suemo has presented at numerous national and international conferences and is recognized as a public speaker, motivational speaker, and skilled communication strategist with a passion for excellence. Dr. Suemo has traveled extensively, visiting the United States, Germany, France, Ghana, Togo, Mali, Guinea Bissau, and Senegal. He is married to Mrs. Shekinah Iember Suemo, and they have five children.
courses: MCM 311: Book Publishing and the Law
MCM 801: Advanced Readings in Communication theories
MCM 821 : Creative workshops in Advertising and Public Relations
MCM 822: Advertising & PR Campaign Planning and Execution

name: Dr. Adeola Abdulateef Elega
bio: Dr. Adeola Abdulateef Elega holds a PhD from Eastern Mediterranean University with a specialization in Communication and Media Studies. His research interests are meta-analysis in media studies, new media and journalism, media framing, interpersonal communication and intercultural communication.

name: Dr. Dimas Garba
bio: Dr. Dimas Garba is a Senior Lecturer in the Department of Political Science and International Relations at Nile University of Nigeria, specializing in international relations. Before joining Nile University in 2024, he lectured for 11 years in the Department of Political Science at Federal University Dutsin-Ma (FUDMA), Katsina State, Nigeria. Dr. Garba earned his first degree in Political Science from Bayero University Kano, followed by an M.Sc. in International Relations from the University of Essex, UK. He completed his Ph.D. in Political Science with a specialization in International Relations at FUDMA. Additionally, he holds a Master’s degree in Public Policy and Administration (MPPA) from Bayero University Kano, which he obtained in 2012. During his tenure at FUDMA, Dr. Garba held several key administrative positions, including Acting Head of the Department of Political Science, Pioneer Deputy Director of the Center for Democracy, Peace and Conflict Resolution (CDPCR), Pioneer Deputy Director and Director of Information and Communication Technology (ICT), and Pioneer Acting Director of the Directorate of Management Information System (MIS), a role he held until his departure to Nile University. He also served as Editorial Secretary for the FUDMA International Journal of Social Sciences (FUDIJOSS), Deputy Managing Editor and Editorial Secretary for the Journal of Conflict Resolution & Social Issues (JCORSI), and Editorial Secretary for the FUDMA Journal of Politics and International Affairs (FUJOPIA).
courses: POL371 Analysis and Management of Conflict
POS815 Methods and Techniques of Political Enquiry
IRD827 Theories and Practice of Diplomacy

name: Assoc. Prof. Hakeem Onapajo
bio: Dr Onapajo holds a PhD in Political Science from the University of KwaZulu Natal, South Africa. He was a Post-Doctoral Fellow in the Department of Politics and International Studies at the University of Zululand, South Africa. He has also lectured in the School of Social Sciences of the University of KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. He researches in the areas of conflict, security and elections in Africa. One of Nigeria’s most cited political scientists (according to GoogleScholar’s citations and AD Scientific Index), Dr Onapajo’s publications in top-rated publication outlets are significant contributions in his discipline. Dr Onapajo is an awardee of the African Humanities Program postdoctoral fellowship awarded by the American Council of Learned Societies. He has delivered talks on topics in his specialization at local and international forums including the Chatham House of the United Kingdom. He has consulted for state and non-state agencies on various developmental issues around peace-building, elections and democratization. Some of them include the Presidential Amnesty Office, The Electoral Institute of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC), the Westminster Foundation for Democracy (WFD) and the African Heritage Institution.

name: Prof. Moussa Mahamat Boukar
bio: Prof. Moussa is a Professor of Computer Science in the Departments of Computer Science and Software Engineering at Nile University of Nigeria, where he has been a faculty member since 2013. He is the Dean of the Faculty of Computing Studies. Prof. Moussa completed his PhD and M.Sc. at Blacksea University, Georgia and International Alatoo University, Kyrgyzstan, respectively. His research interests lie in the areas of Programming Languages, Machine Learning and Content Management System Technology (CMS). He has collaborated actively with researchers in several other disciplines of Computer Science, particularly Computer Programming on problems at the software interface and Machine Learning. Prof. Moussa has served on roughly several conferences and workshop program committees. He also served as the Conference Chair for ICECCO-2017 and ICECCO-2019 which was indexed by IEEE and Web of Science. Additionally, Prof. Moussa served as a member of the Editorial Board for American Research Journal of Computer Science and Information Technology and the Professional Association for the Advancement of Technology (IEEE).
courses: CSC 102 Problem solving and Algorithm with Python.
CSC 303 Object Oriented Programming with Java

name: Prof. Prema Kirubakaran
bio: Dr.A.Prema Kirubakaran is an Associate Professor and Head of the Department of Information Technology & Information Systems. She has 21 years of Teaching Experience and 15 years of research experience in Indian universities and other foreign universities. She has published 51 articles in National and International Journals. She has received many awards for her research work, Teaching skills, and administration abilities. She is an article reviewer of many international journals, including Springer Journals, Taylor & Francis, CSI, ICT Research Journal, AJCIS Research, and Online reviewer for Shiksha higher studies. She holds 4 Indian patents and one UK patent. She is currently working on three consultancy projects. She is a Board of Study member in various institutions. She is in the Asia and India Book of Records for her research articles. In 2023, as an editor of IoT books, her work was initiated for the Guinness world record attempt. She is a lifetime member of various technical organizations like CSI, IRA, and SDIWC. She is the editor of the Indian Journal of Science and Research. She is currently pursuing her post-doctoral fellowship in Quantum Computing.
designation: Deputy VC (Central Admin) & HOD, Information Technology & Systems

name: Dr. Peter O. Koleoso
bio: Dr. Peter O. Koleoso is a lecturer in the Computer Science Department of Nile University of Nigeria. Dr. Peter received his Bachelor’s degree in Mathematical Sciences (Statistics option) in 2008 at the University of Agriculture, Abeokuta. He obtained Masters’ degree in Medical Statistics at University of Leicester, UK in 2015. He also obtained his Ph.D. degree in Statistics at University of Ibadan in 2022. He is an early career researcher and has garnered experience from both research and lecturing in academics. He has published some articles both in local and international journals, and conferences. His research interest focuses on statistical modelling and mathematical statistics. He is a registered member of Professional Statisticians Society of Nigeria (PSSN), Royal Statistical Society (RSS), International Statistical Institute (ISI) and International Biometric Society (IBS).

name: Dr. Ibrahim Anka Salihu
bio: Dr. Ibrahim Anka Salihu is a Senior Lecturer in the departments of Software Engineering and Information Technology and the current head of both departments. He has a background and experience in Software Engineering and an ambition to eventually have a broad-based career in research in Computing and Software Engineering. Dr. Ibrahim’s research interests include software quality and testing, software development methodologies, requirements engineering, mobile apps development and testing, algorithm design, algorithm optimization, cloud computing and IoT. He has published many research articles in top ranking international journals and conferences. He is also a reviewer for several international journals and conferences.

name: Dr. Muhammad A. Suleiman
bio: Dr. Muhammad A. Suleiman is a Senior Lecturer in the Department of Software Engineering and Information Technology, Nile University of Nigeria. He has 15 years progressive working experience in both academic (research) and industries. For more than a decade, he has accomplished design and implementation of numerous IT and Software solutions as a senior Systems Analyst, Researcher, Consultant, and Lecturer. He has obtained BSc., M.Sc., and Ph.D degrees in Computer Science and is committed to interdisciplinary scholarships. Dr. Muhammad’s research interests are natural language processing, data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence, data mining/information retrieval, anonymous communication and privacy-enhancing technologies. He has published more than 10 peer reviewed papers and book chapters, many of which are in the area of AI modeling and anonymous communication. He is looking for potential MSc. and PhD students that are interested in his area of research to work with.
courses: IFT303: Web Development using Content Management Systems

name: Dr. Bilkisu L. Muhammad-Bello
bio: Dr. Bilkisu L. Muhammad-Bello is a Senior Lecturer in the Department of Software Engineering and Information Technology, Nile University of Nigeria. She started her career as a banker and has been in the academia since 2012. She has a B.Tech in Mathematics/Computer Science (1st class honours), MSc. In Advanced Computer Science and Information Technologies Management (Distinction) and a PhD. In Computer Science and Electrical Engineering. Her research interests are in Cloud & Edge Computing, Internet of Things (IoT), Autonomous Database Systems, Parallel and Distributed Data Processing & Analytics, Machine Learning and Deep Learning. Dr. Bilkisu is committed to academic excellence and is interested in working with potential MSc. and PhD. candidates. She is also open to interdisciplinary research collaborations. She has presented her research works in top ranking conferences and also published in reputable journals. She is the co-editor of the Springer’s CCIS series on Information and Communications Technology and its Applications, and a reviewer for several international journals and conferences including Journal of King Saud University – Computer and Information Sciences. She is a member of Computer Professional Registration Council of Nigeria (CPN), IAENG, IACSIT, and IEEE.

name: Assoc. Prof. Petrus Nzerem
bio: Associate Professor Petrus Nzerem is the Dean of Faculty of Engineering. He obtained his Bachelor’s degree in Polymer and Textile Engineering from the Federal University of Technology, Owerri, in 2004. Petrus then proceeded for a Master’s degree in Energy and Environment at the University of Leeds upon completing his National Youth Service Programme. In 2013, he obtained a Doctorate degree in Chemical Engineering and Analytical Science from the University of Manchester before returning to Nigeria to take up a lectureship position at the Nile University of Nigeria. Petrus’ research interests include sustainable and renewable energy, waste-to-energy and chemicals conversion, petroleum economics, and drilling fluids. He is a member of the Society of Petroleum Engineers and Nigeria Society of Engineers, and also a registered COREN Engineer.

name: Dr. Nyangwarimam Obadiah Ali
bio: Engr. Dr. Nyangwarimam Obadiah Ali is a Senior Lecturer and Head of the Department of Computer Engineering at the Faculty of Engineering, Nile University of Nigeria. He earned his Bachelor of Engineering (B.Eng.) in Electrical and Computer Engineering from the Federal University of Technology Minna, Niger State, Nigeria. He then obtained a Master of Engineering (M.Eng.) in Electrical-Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering from the University of Technology Malaysia in 2014, followed by a Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering from the same university in 2018. From 2013 to 2018, Dr. Ali was part of the Advanced RF and Microwave Research Group in the Department of Communication Engineering at the Faculty of Electrical Engineering, University of Technology Malaysia. His research interests include Antennas and Propagation, Wireless Communication, Radio Frequency Devices, Reconfigurable Antennas, Filtennas, Microstrip Filters, Internet of Things (IoT), and Embedded System Design. Dr. Ali serves as a reviewer for various international journals and conferences, including those indexed by ISI and SCOPUS. He is a member of several professional organizations, including the Nigerian Society of Engineers (MNSE), the Nigerian Institution of Electrical Electronics Engineers (MNIEEE), and he is a registered engineer with the Council for the Regulation of Engineering in Nigeria (COREN).
courses: Research methodology for Final Year Projects (CPE 587)
Data structures and Analysis of Algorithm (CPE 312)
ICE 102 – Introduction to Information and Communication Engineering (ICE 102)

name: Prof. Abdulhameed Danjuma Mambo
bio: Engr. Dr. Abdulhameed Danjuma Mambo is currently a Professor, and Dean of Environmental Sciences, he is also the Head of Department (HOD), Civil Engineering, Nile University of Nigeria Abuja. He obtained his B.Eng. degree in Civil Engineering from the Federal University of Technology Minna in January 2006. In December 2009, through the PTDF merit Scholarship, he completed his M.Sc. in Building Services Engineering with a Distinction from Loughborough University, United Kingdom. He gained the Loughborough University Ph.D. studentship in 2010 and completed his Ph.D. in Civil and Building Engineering in December 2013. Dr. Abdulhameed started his engineering career as a Project Manager with IET Abuja from 2006 to 2008 where he managed the design, construction, and maintenance of several buildings in Abuja. Later, he was an Assistant Lecturer in Civil Engineering and a Post-Doctoral Research Associate at Loughborough University UK working on Reinvent the Toilet Challenge funded by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation for a period of about 3 years (2010-2013). He had a brief stint between 2015-2016 working for the UN-Habitat as an associate consultant on a project promoting energy and resource efficiency building codes for Nigeria. His research interests include General Civil Engineering, Sustainable Infrastructure, Sustainable Construction, Building Energy Efficiency, Building Energy Management Systems, Smart Cities, and Artificial Intelligent Building Systems. Engr. Dr. Abdulhameed Danjuma Mambo is a corporate member of the Nigerian Society of Engineers, European Energy Centre, and World Society of Sustainable Energy Technologies. He is a fellow of the Nigeria Institution of Civil Engineers and is fully registered as a Civil Engineer with the Council for the Regulation of Engineering in Nigeria (COREN) since 2015.
designation: Dean of Environmental Science & HOD, Civil Engineering
courses: Design for sustainability and Construction Methods

reviews.comment: Hard to keep up with the pace

name: Assoc. Prof. Onyebuchi Mogbo
bio: Dr. Onyebuchi Mogbo is an Associate Professor at Nile University of Nigeria where he Lectures and helps students achieve their dreams. He has a verse range of research interest and is always keen to see the big picture while keeping abreast of business details and tight schedules. An excellent communicator and a welcoming personality, Dr Mogbo finds interest in activities that promote a culture of harmony and progress in all activities he encounters.
courses: CVE 849: Professional Practice in Construction Management

name: Dr. Akeem Gbenga Amuda
bio: Dr Akeem Amuda joined the Department of Civil Engineering of Nile University in 2019. He taught a wide range of undergraduate and graduate courses in Geotechnical Engineering and related fields. His primary research interests included the Offshore Geotechnics, Improvement of Expansive and collapsible soils, Physical Modelling, Embankment and Hydraulic Structures and Sustainable Engineering. He received his PhD in Civil Engineering from the University of Malaysia Sarawak in 2019. At the University of Malaysia Sarawak, Akeem was a ZGS Graduate Research Fellow and a Research Assistant at the Centre of Research Excellence Construction on Peat Soils. Dr Akeem held the 2019 Highest Publication Award for Faculty of Engineering Nile University and served on the editorial board and reviewer of academic publications. Dr Akeem has extensive experience in building and infrastructural construction for Government Agencies and Private firms. He has been involved in many construction projects which include the CBN state Office, Federal Court of Appeal Complex, Dams and Highway Construction. He is a member of Professional Bodies which include NSE, COREN, and ICE (UK)
courses: CVE 832 – Advanced soil Analysis for Highway and Airfields

reviews.comment: Too much theory, not enough practice

name: Dr. Nyangwarimam Obadiah Ali
bio: Engr. Dr. Nyangwarimam Obadiah Ali is a Senior Lecturer and Head of the Department of Computer Engineering at the Faculty of Engineering, Nile University of Nigeria. He earned his Bachelor of Engineering (B.Eng.) in Electrical and Computer Engineering from the Federal University of Technology Minna, Niger State, Nigeria. He then obtained a Master of Engineering (M.Eng.) in Electrical-Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering from the University of Technology Malaysia in 2014, followed by a Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering from the same university in 2018. From 2013 to 2018, Dr. Ali was part of the Advanced RF and Microwave Research Group in the Department of Communication Engineering at the Faculty of Electrical Engineering, University of Technology Malaysia. His research interests include Antennas and Propagation, Wireless Communication, Radio Frequency Devices, Reconfigurable Antennas, Filtennas, Microstrip Filters, Internet of Things (IoT), and Embedded System Design. Dr. Ali serves as a reviewer for various international journals and conferences, including those indexed by ISI and SCOPUS. He is a member of several professional organizations, including the Nigerian Society of Engineers (MNSE), the Nigerian Institution of Electrical Electronics Engineers (MNIEEE), and he is a registered engineer with the Council for the Regulation of Engineering in Nigeria (COREN).
courses: Research methodology for Final Year Projects (CPE 587)
Data structures and Analysis of Algorithm (CPE 312)
ICE 102 – Introduction to Information and Communication Engineering (ICE 102)

reviews.comment: Hard to stay engaged in class

name: Prof. Sadiq Thomas
bio: Dr. Sadiq Thomas is an Associate Professor and Head of Nile University of Nigeria’s Computer Engineering Department. He received his Bachelor’s degree in Electronics and Computer Engineering at Brunel University, UK, in 2005. He also obtained a Ph.D in Electronics and Computer Engineering from the Brunel University/University of Leeds, UK in 2009. He was with the Glamorgan University, UK as a research Assistant between 2009 and 2011. He was also a Research Fellow at the Brunel University, London, UK and Heriot Watt University, Edinburgh, UK between 2011 to 2012 and 2012 to 2013 respectively. He has over 10 years’ experience garnered from research and Lecturing in the Academics. He has published many articles in journals (indexed in ISI, SCOPUS, etc.) and conferences. His research interests include modelling and Simulation, finite element modelling of Electromagnetic Acoustic Transducer (EMAT) sensors, etc. He is a registered COREN Member as well as a Member of the British Institute of Non Destructive Testing (BINDT) and Institute of Engineering and Technology (IET), Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE).

name: Prof. Steve A. Adeshina
bio: Professor Steve A. Adeshina is a distinguished academic in the Faculty of Engineering at Nile University of Nigeria, where he also serves as the General Manager of Nile Consult & Services Limited. This business consulting subsidiary of the university offers comprehensive consulting, training (including bespoke short professional courses), and specialized services across various sectors of the economy. Professor Adeshina earned his B.Eng. degree in Electrical and Electronics Engineering from the University of Ilorin, Nigeria, and a Ph.D. in Computer Vision and Engineering from the University of Manchester, UK, in 2010. After a successful career in computing within both the private and public sectors in Nigeria, he joined Nile University in 2011. Over the years, he has held several key academic and administrative positions, including Deputy Vice-Chancellor, Administration (2014-2020). His research focuses on the application of Computer Vision and Deep Learning techniques to the analysis of medical and biological images and data. He has published over 60 articles in peer-reviewed conferences and journals, with a particular interest in using these techniques for automated cancer detection and diagnosis. Additionally, Professor Adeshina is interested in the use of electronic voting systems to promote good governance, and he has published significant work in this area. Professor Adeshina is a member of several national and international professional organizations, including the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (MIEEE), the Association for Computing Machinery (MACM), the Nigerian Society of Engineers (MNSE), the Nigerian Computer Society (MNCS), and he is a registered engineer with COREN and a certified professional with MCPN, among others.
courses: CPE 503 – Microcomputer Software and Hardware Techniques
CSC 815 – Advanced Computer Communications and Networks
CSC 918 – Computer Systems Organization and Architecture

reviews.comment: Good balance of theory and practice

name: Assoc. Prof. Omotayo Olabowale Oshiga
bio: Dr. Omotayo Oshiga is the Head of the Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Nile University of Nigeria. He is also an Associate Professor with the Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering. He received a B.Tech. degree in Physics Electronics from the Federal University of Technology, Minna, Niger State in 2010, and an M.Sc. degree in Wireless Communication Systems from Brunel University, London, UK in 2011. He received his PhD degree in Electrical Engineering from Jacobs University, Bremen, Germany in February 2015. He was employed as Lecturer I in the Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Nile University of Nigeria, Abuja from 2015 to 2016. He went on to pursue his Postdoctoral Fellowship in Hong Kong with Hong Kong Baptist University and Hong Kong Polytechnic University from 2016 to 2019. His current research areas include estimation theory, signal processing, wireless sensor networks, indoor and outdoor positioning, tracking and navigation, wireless sensing etc..
courses: EEE 927: Advanced Research and Development Techniques

name: Assoc. Prof. Petrus Nzerem
bio: Associate Professor Petrus Nzerem is the Dean of Faculty of Engineering. He obtained his Bachelor’s degree in Polymer and Textile Engineering from the Federal University of Technology, Owerri, in 2004. Petrus then proceeded for a Master’s degree in Energy and Environment at the University of Leeds upon completing his National Youth Service Programme. In 2013, he obtained a Doctorate degree in Chemical Engineering and Analytical Science from the University of Manchester before returning to Nigeria to take up a lectureship position at the Nile University of Nigeria. Petrus’ research interests include sustainable and renewable energy, waste-to-energy and chemicals conversion, petroleum economics, and drilling fluids. He is a member of the Society of Petroleum Engineers and Nigeria Society of Engineers, and also a registered COREN Engineer.

name: Dr. Temitayo Samson Ogedengbe
bio: Temitayo Samson Ogedengbe (Ph.D.) is a Senior Lecturer in the department of Mechanical Engineering, Nile University of Nigeria. Previously, he lectured in the department of Mechanical Engineering of Elizade University, Nigeria. He earned his PhD with specialization in Industrial & Production Engineering from the prestigious University of Ilorin, Nigeria. He has served in several positions and in many committees both at departmental and faculty levels since joining Nile University of Nigeria. He is an excellent tutor who constantly maintains a high score in student knowledge impartation using available tools and improvising where necessary. This hardwork culminated in his award as top performer/best academic staff in FY2023 university awards and recognition. Dr. Ogedengbe’s strong desire for research excellence has resulted in  a lot of journal articles indexed in popular indexing outlets such as google scholar, SCOPUS and web of science. He has maintained a spot in the annual list of “Top 500 researchers in Nigeria” with recognition from the university in FY2024 for this feat. His research interests included areas such as advanced manufacturing, materials engineering, machining, nanotechnology and ergonomics.  Dr. Ogedengbe is a corporate member of both the council of regulation for engineering in Nigeria (COREN), Nigerian Society of Engineers (NSE) and the Nigeria Institute of Mechanical Engineering (NIMechE) where he currently serves as Technical Secretary for the Abuja Chapter.

name: Prof. Abdulhameed Danjuma Mambo
bio: Engr. Dr. Abdulhameed Danjuma Mambo is currently a Professor, and Dean of Environmental Sciences, he is also the Head of Department (HOD), Civil Engineering, Nile University of Nigeria Abuja. He obtained his B.Eng. degree in Civil Engineering from the Federal University of Technology Minna in January 2006. In December 2009, through the PTDF merit Scholarship, he completed his M.Sc. in Building Services Engineering with a Distinction from Loughborough University, United Kingdom. He gained the Loughborough University Ph.D. studentship in 2010 and completed his Ph.D. in Civil and Building Engineering in December 2013. Dr. Abdulhameed started his engineering career as a Project Manager with IET Abuja from 2006 to 2008 where he managed the design, construction, and maintenance of several buildings in Abuja. Later, he was an Assistant Lecturer in Civil Engineering and a Post-Doctoral Research Associate at Loughborough University UK working on Reinvent the Toilet Challenge funded by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation for a period of about 3 years (2010-2013). He had a brief stint between 2015-2016 working for the UN-Habitat as an associate consultant on a project promoting energy and resource efficiency building codes for Nigeria. His research interests include General Civil Engineering, Sustainable Infrastructure, Sustainable Construction, Building Energy Efficiency, Building Energy Management Systems, Smart Cities, and Artificial Intelligent Building Systems. Engr. Dr. Abdulhameed Danjuma Mambo is a corporate member of the Nigerian Society of Engineers, European Energy Centre, and World Society of Sustainable Energy Technologies. He is a fellow of the Nigeria Institution of Civil Engineers and is fully registered as a Civil Engineer with the Council for the Regulation of Engineering in Nigeria (COREN) since 2015.
designation: Dean of Environmental Science & HOD, Civil Engineering
courses: Design for sustainability and Construction Methods

name: Dr. Timothy Onosahwo Iyendo
bio: Dr. Iyendo obtained his undergraduate degree in architecture from the Federal University of Technology, Yola (now known as Modibbo Adama University of Technology, Yola) in 2006. He earned Master of Science (M.Sc.) and Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) degrees in architecture from Eastern Mediterranean University in August 2011 and November 2016, respectively. Dr. Iyendo has over 10 years of teaching and research experience. He has published many articles in reputable journals indexed in the Web of Science Core Collection, as well as in SCOPUS and conference proceedings. He has worked closely in research collaboration with academics, researchers, and scientists in Turkey, Cyprus, China, Iran, and Nigeria. His research is based on a transdisciplinary approach that includes fields such as soundscape and landscape ecology, therapeutic and sensorial architecture, the psychology of music and music therapy intervention, the psychology of art and art therapy intervention, evidence-based design practice, design education, indoor environmental quality, climate-responsive architecture, the effects of social media and the internet, and visual multimedia (visual arts and performing arts)/audio-visual intervention. In addition to his research achievements, Dr. Iyendo has actively contributed to the academic community through presentations at international conferences, workshops, and seminars. He is currently serving as an editorial board member of two journals, the Journal of Studies in Science and Engineering, and the Journal of Contemporary Urban Affairs. From October 2020 to August 2022, Dr. Iyendo held a full-time Assistant Professor position in the Faculty of Architecture, Department of Architecture, at Near East University, Northern Cyprus, Turkey. From February 2017 to July 2020, Dr. Iyendo served as a full-time lecturer in the Faculty of Architecture at the European University of Lefke, where he was promoted to the rank of Assistant Professor/Senior Academic in November 2017. Additionally, Dr. Iyendo gained valuable teaching, administrative, and research experience as a research/teaching assistant in the Department of Architecture at Eastern Mediterranean University from 2012 to 2016.
courses: ARC 407 – Acoustics, Noise Control and Lighting in Buildings
ARC 303 – Building Components and Methods III (Traditional Construction)
ARC 204 – Building Components and Methods II (Timber and Steel)

name: Dr. Patrick Chukwuemeke Uwajeh
bio: Dr. Patrick C. Uwajeh is a Lecturer I and staff in the department of Architecture at Nile University of Nigeria. Dr. Patrick C. Uwajeh obtained his Bachelor’s degree in Architecture at Nnamdi Azikiwe University, Awka; Nigeria in 2009. He received a Master’s degree in Architecture from the Eastern Mediterranean University, North Cyprus; Turkey in 2015. He also obtained a PhD degree in Architecture from the Eastern Mediterranean University, North Cyprus; Turkey in 2019. He was with the Eastern Mediterranean University, North Cyprus; Turkey as a Research / Teaching Assistant between 2015-2018. He has over 5 years’ experience as a consultant and project manager in the construction industry and over 5 years’ experience garnered from research and Lecturing in the Academics. He has published several articles in international journals indexed in Science Citation Index Expanded (SCIE), refereed journals and conference papers in Nigeria, Turkey and the USA. He also served as an editorial board member for 4 years, working in the capacity of a copy editor for the International Journal of Contemporary Urban Affairs, (IJCUA) Turkey.
courses: ARC 203 – Building Components and Methods II
ARC 303 – Building Components and Methods III

name: Dr. Tenigbade Yewande Odu
bio: Dr. Tenigbade Yewande Odu (Ph.D., RSV) is a lecturer in the Department of Estate Management at the Faculty of Environmental Sciences, Nile University of Nigeria. She is a registered estate surveyor and valuer, having previously practiced with Ubosi Eleh + Co. before transitioning into academia. Before joining Nile University, Dr. Odu lectured in the Department of Estate Management at Yaba College of Technology and the University of Lagos. Dr. Odu earned her Doctoral degree from the University of KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa, where she specialized in environmental sustainability in the built environment. She is certified as a green building expert by the IFC EDGE and as an international DGNB consultant by the German Sustainable Building Council. Dr. Odu also co-hosted “The Built Environment,” a radio program on Yabatech Radio 89.3 FM. Her research focuses on sustainability in the built environment, with her work being published in various academic journals. Dr. Odu’s contributions to the field continue to grow, reflecting her commitment to advancing environmental sustainability in the built environment.

name: Dr. Sirajo Yakubu
bio: Dr. Sirajo Yakubu is a Senior Lecturer in Law and the Head of Department, Public & International Law at the Faculty of Law, Nile University of Nigeria. He teaches Company Law and Administrative Law. He previously taught Commercial Law. He is a member of the Cambridge International Symposium on Economic Crime Secretariat at Jesus College, University of Cambridge. He was a member of the Committee set up by the Federal Government of Nigeria to draft the Whistleblower and Witness Protection bill 2019.

name: Dr. Fadila Abubakar Sodangi
bio: Dr. Fadila Abubakar Sodangi is a lecturer in the Department of Private & Islamic Law at Nile University of Nigeria. Before joining Nile University, she lectured in the Department of Private & Business Law at Nasarawa State University, Keffi, where she earned her Ph.D. in Law with a specialization in Comparative Company Law and Corporate Governance. Her research interests also extend to Intellectual Property Law and Information Technology Law. Dr. Sodangi has published her work in various peer-reviewed journals, including those indexed in Q1 Scopus.

bio: Dr. Sirajo Yakubu is a Senior Lecturer in Law and the Head of Department, Public & International Law at the Faculty of Law, Nile University of Nigeria. He teaches Company Law and Administrative Law. He previously taught Commercial Law. He is a member of the Cambridge International Symposium on Economic Crime Secretariat at Jesus College, University of Cambridge. He was a member of the Committee set up by the Federal Government of Nigeria to draft the Whistleblower and Witness Protection bill 2019.

name: Dr. Chinenye Joy Mgbeokwere
bio: Dr. Chinenye Joy Mgbeokwere, is a Doctor of Law and Deputy Post Graduate co-ordinator, Faculty of Law, Nile University of Nigeria Abuja. She obtained her first and second Degree from the Premier University of Ibadan, Oyo State Nigeria in 2005 and 2009 respectively where She proceeded to Law School Abuja and was called to the Nigerian Bar in 2006. She obtained a PhD in Law from the University of Abuja Nigeria in 2018. She has over ten years experience in research and has taught for several years. She has carried out research on Constitutional Law; Human Rights; Gender Law; Telecommunications Law; ICT Law; Public Law; Energy Law and Development Law. She has attended several national and international conferences, seminars and workshops where she presented papers in different areas of law. She is a public policy analyst and a gender based activist. She has written and published articles in several learned journals both local and international.

International Trade and Digital Management Law 1
International Trade and Digital Management Law 11

name: Dr. Fadila Abubakar Sodangi
bio: Dr. Fadila Abubakar Sodangi is a lecturer in the Department of Private & Islamic Law at Nile University of Nigeria. Before joining Nile University, she lectured in the Department of Private & Business Law at Nasarawa State University, Keffi, where she earned her Ph.D. in Law with a specialization in Comparative Company Law and Corporate Governance. Her research interests also extend to Intellectual Property Law and Information Technology Law. Dr. Sodangi has published her work in various peer-reviewed journals, including those indexed in Q1 Scopus.

name: Dr. Ayodele Morocco-Clarke
bio: Born in Lagos, Nigeria and descendant of kin from the West Indies, Sierra Leone and the Republic of Benin, Dr. Ayodele Morocco-Clarke is a Nigerian of mixed heritage. She is a multi-award winning Solicitor and Advocate of the Supreme Court of Nigeria who specializes in Environmental and Energy Law and interned at ExxonMobil International Limited in London. Dr. Morocco-Clarke has numerous years experience practicing commercial and energy law at some of the top law firms in Nigeria and lectured at the Lagos State University.
courses: International Environmental Law for the Petroleum and Mining Industry
Environmental Law for the Energy Mix

name: Assoc. Prof. Umar Abbas Ibrahim
bio: Dr. Umar Abbas Ibrahim is an Associate Professor in Finance in the Department of Business Administration. Dr. Umar’s research interests include corporate capital structure, working capital management, corporate governance, international finance, and project management. He is also a member of Nile Journal for Business and Economics Editorial Board. Recently, Umar extended his research interest in areas of marketing and strategic management to foster links with corporate success. His academic interest and expertise has continued to improve the postgraduate students’ interest in research and academic writing.
courses: BUS 902: Seminar in Strategic Management and Entrepreneurship
MBA 841: Risk Management and Closing Project

name: Dr. Nasamu Gambo
bio: Dr. Nasamu Gambo is an accomplished academic and professional with a Ph.D. from Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria, one of the premier universities in West Africa. He is also a CISCO Certified Networking Programmer (CCNP), having completed his certification with the prestigious CISCO Inc., USA. Dr. Gambo has extensive and diverse experience in the field of education, including roles in lecturing, ICT, strategic business financing, innovative entrepreneurship development and training, as well as project and general management. As of 2024, he has authored and published over 50 peer-reviewed research articles in both national and international journals. Throughout his career, Dr. Gambo has participated in numerous workshops, training programs, courses, and conferences around the world, contributing to his multifaceted expertise.

reviews.comment: Hard to follow, but assignments help
Makes difficult concepts easy to understand

name: Dr. Akeem Adewale Bakare
bio: BAKARE, Akeem Adewale is a lecturer and Human Resource professional hailing from Ibadan, Oyo State. He bagged PhD in Management Science at Ladoke Akintola University of Technology, Ogbomoso. Oyo State. He also had M.Sc in Industrial Relations and Human Resource Management and B. Sc Business administration both from Olabisi Onabanjo University, Ago-Iwoye, Ogun State. He joined the services of the Nile University of Nigeria (NUN) in 2022 in the department of Business administration. The research interest areas are Human Resources, General and Strategic Management, Entrepreneurship, Organisational Behaviour and other related fields in business management including marketing.

name: Dr. Lucky Onmonya
bio: Dr. Onmonya Lucky is a Senior Lecturer at Nile University of Nigeria, with a comprehensive academic and professional background in Accounting and Finance. He holds a Ph.D. in Accounting & Finance from the University of Jos, an M.Sc. in Development Studies from Benue State University, an M.Sc. in Finance from the University of Calabar, and an MBA from Bayero University. Additionally, he earned a Postgraduate Diploma in Development Administration from Obafemi Awolowo University, specializing in Development Finance and Project Monitoring and Evaluation Management. Dr. Onmonya also holds a B.Sc. in Accounting from Bayero University and has completed a Certificate in Computer Operation from the University of Port Harcourt. Dr. Onmonya is a Fellow of the Institute of Development Finance and Project Management (FDFPM), the Institute of Development Administration of Nigeria (FDA), and a member of the Nigerian Institute of Management (AMNIM), the Association of National Accountants of Nigeria (CNA), and the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nigeria. His interests span across Business Development, Result-Based Monitoring and Evaluation, Socio-economic Impact Assessment of Projects, Project Management, Feasibility Study and Business Plan Preparation, Development Finance, and Entrepreneurship Development. He is a seasoned professional accountant with 25 years of progressive experience. Dr. Onmonya has held various significant roles, including Executive Director of the Institute of Development Finance and Project Management (2016-2022), Business Development Service Provider for the Bank of Industry, and Program Director for the Central Bank of Nigeria’s (CBN) Entrepreneurship Development Centre, North Central Zone (2016-2018). He has also served as a Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist and Advisor for several organizations, including the Africa Community Bridge Foundation, IDAN/USAID MEMS, and the Nigeria Building and Road Research Institute. His extensive career also includes positions such as Accountant at NASCO Group of Company, Jos, Principal Partner in Audit and Tax at Jonah Arimuna and Co Chartered Accountants, and Sector Specialist in Impact Evaluation at Nexier Capital Ltd. In academia, Dr. Onmonya has taught accounting courses at institutions such as Imo State University, Kano Study Centre, the Institute of Development Administration of Nigeria (moderated by the University of Ibadan DLC), and the University of Jos. He has published numerous peer-reviewed articles in both international and local journals and is the author of the book *Entrepreneurship and New Venture Management*.

name: Prof. Ofili Ugwudioha
bio: Prof. Ofili Ugwudioha is a Professor of Accounting in the Faculty of Management Sciences. He holds PhD in Accounting and PhD in Financial Management. He is a Fellow of 8 Accounting and Management professional bodies across the globe. He has authored 9 books in Accounting, Finance and Economics as well 33 papers in the areas of Accounting/Finance. He was the past President/Chairman of Governing Council of the Chartered Institute of Administration. He was a member of the panel set up by the Head of Service of the Federation in 2007 which visited Britain, South Africa, and Ghana to ascertain the possibility of integrating professional certificates into the scheme of service in Nigeria. He was the former Chairman of Board of Directors of Adarice Nigeria Limited (an Enugu State Government’s owned Rice Production Company) and Chairman of Board of Directors of many other corporate organizations. He is a member of Governing Council of Enugu State Polytechnic.
courses: ACC 102: Introduction to Financial Accounting I
ACC 201: Introduction to Financial Accounting II
ACC 204: Introduction to Cost & Management Accounting
ACC 320: Public Sector Accounting and Finance I
ACC 403: Public Sector Accounting and Finance II

name: Dr. Ayogu Sunday
bio: Ayogu Sunday is a Lecturer in the accounting department of Nile University of Nigeria. He received a B.Sc.  in  Accounting from University of Nigeria, Nsukka. He holds a M.Sc in accounting and finance from Bingham University & a M.Sc in Financial Economics from University of Abuja.

name: Prof. Taofik Uthman
bio: Professor Taofik Uthman is a Professor of Biochemistry and currently heads the Department of Biochemistry, Nile University of Nigeria. He holds BSc, MSc. and PhD. degrees in Biochemistry from the University of Ilorin, Ilorin, Nigeria. He was awarded postdoctoral research fellowship and training at Research Centre for Phytomedicine, University of Fort Hare, Alice, South Africa (2009-2010) and Research Centre for Plant Growth and Development, University of KwaZulu-Natal, Pietermaritzburg, South Africa (2012-2013). He was with Cape Peninsula University of Technology, Wellington, South Africa (2018) and University of Limerick, Ireland (2019) as a Visiting Researcher. Prof. Uthman is a seasoned and dedicated academic with over 20 years experience as a University Lecturer and Researcher. He has supervised several undergraduate (BSc) projects numbering over 200 and 11 postgraduate theses. He has to his credit over 60 in-depth scientific articles, which are published in reputable journals (indexed in Scopus, Web of Science etc). He is a member of several scientific societies including Biochemical Society (UK), Nigerian Society for Biochemistry & Molecular Biology and Society for Medicinal Plants & Economic Development (South Africa) to mention a few. His research interests include Environmental Toxicology, Phytomedicine and Plant Biochemistry with focus on the search for antioxidants, bioherbicides and biofertilizers from natural products.

name: Prof. Sani Sambo Datsugwai Mohammed
bio: Professor Sani Sambo Datsugwai Mohammed, Ph.D., is the Head of the Department of Biology, Microbiology, and Science Laboratory Technology Programmes at the Faculty of Science, Nile University of Nigeria. With 19 years of university research and teaching experience, he specializes in Biology, Microbiology, and Biotechnology. Before joining Nile University, he held positions at IBB University, Lapai, and Kaduna State University, Kaduna. Professor Mohammed has served in various academic and administrative roles at both Nile University and his previous institutions. He is a sought-after resource person for accreditation processes and has been a guest speaker at numerous conferences. His research interests include Food/Industrial Microbiology, Biotechnology (Genetics, Genomics, Gene Expression), Virology, Bio-preservation of foods using lactic acid bacteria (LAB) and their bacteriocins, enzyme production and characterization, food fermentation, strain and process improvements, wine production, bioremediation, biodeterioration and biodegradation, and environmental quality analysis. He is a member of several professional organizations, including the Institute of Science Laboratory Technology (FISLT), Institute of Management Consultants (FIMC), Certified Management Consultant (MCMC), Institute of Public Analysts of Nigeria (MIPAN), Society for Testing Laboratory Analysts of Nigeria (MSoTLAN), Nigerian Society for Microbiology (MNSM), Biotechnology Society of Nigeria (MBSN), Nigerian Institute of Food Science and Technology (MNIFST), Nigerian Association of Teachers of Technology (MNATT), and the American Society for Microbiology (MASM). Throughout his career, Professor Mohammed has taught, supervised, and mentored numerous Diploma, B.Sc., PGD, M.Sc., and Ph.D. students. He has authored 149 scholarly articles in national and international high-impact journals, as of July 2024, with significant citations on Google Scholar and ResearchGate. He holds a recent patent on the application of synthesized-modified nanoclay technology for shielding grains from fungal contamination and mycotoxins. Additionally, he has published two books, contributed to several conference proceedings, extended abstracts, book chapters, and abstracts. Professor Mohammed is also an active editorial board member and reviewer for various local and international journals, and he has participated in numerous local and international conferences.

name: Prof. Onyinye Nwagbara
bio: Prof. Nwagbara has more than thirty years of academic, military and technical experience in the regional and global arena as an educator, administrator, military officer, researcher, government official and corporate leader: He is a retired Officer in the U.S. Army; Senior Researcher in the Research and Development Unit of Proctor & Gamble USA; Toxicologist/Chemist and Bureau Chief of Laboratory with the Florida Department of Environmental Protection. Nwagbara is a University Professor of Toxicology/Biomolecular Science, Chemistry, Microbiology & Military Science. Education:

name: Dr. George Mangse
bio: Dr. George Mangse is a Lecturer and Postgraduate Coordinator in the Departments of Biology, Microbiology & Biotechnology, Faculty of Natural & Applied Sciences, Nile University of Nigeria. Dr. Mangse has done research in the fields of in situ sorbent amendment for the remediation of petroleum hydrocarbon contaminated soils. George’s main research interests include the use of molecular biology and next generation sequencing (NGS) techniques to investigate bacterial community structure changes of water and soil samples from the environment following exposure to contamination with organic pollutants. He has also acquired skills in the use of analytical chemistry techniques such as Liquid Chromatography tandem Mass Spectrometry (LC/MS/MS) as well as Gas Chromatography – Mass Spectrometry to analyze micro-pollutants in water samples from the environment. Dr. Mangse holds an M.Sc. in Industrial Biotechnology and a PhD in Environmental Biotechnology from Newcastle University, Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom.

name: Dr. Sharafadeen Adetunji Adeniji
bio: Dr. Sharafadeen Adetunji Adeniji is a physicist and materials scientist with a Ph.D. in Theoretical and Applied Physics from the African University of Science and Technology (AUST) in Abuja, Nigeria. His academic journey began in 2010 when he started as a high school Physics teacher in Abuja, where he inspired a passion for science in his students. During his doctoral studies, he also served as a teaching assistant at AUST, furthering his dedication to education. In 2018, Dr. Adeniji joined the Department of Physics at Nile University of Nigeria, Abuja, where he has been actively involved in teaching, mentoring, and research. His research interests are centered on materials for clean and renewable energy, with a particular focus on developing efficient, low-cost, and environmentally friendly materials for light-emitting devices, solar cells, and supercapacitors. Dr. Adeniji’s work has been published in several Scopus-indexed journals, reflecting his commitment to advancing the field of materials science.

name: Prof. Taofik Uthman
bio: Professor Taofik Uthman is a Professor of Biochemistry and currently heads the Department of Biochemistry, Nile University of Nigeria. He holds BSc, MSc. and PhD. degrees in Biochemistry from the University of Ilorin, Ilorin, Nigeria. He was awarded postdoctoral research fellowship and training at Research Centre for Phytomedicine, University of Fort Hare, Alice, South Africa (2009-2010) and Research Centre for Plant Growth and Development, University of KwaZulu-Natal, Pietermaritzburg, South Africa (2012-2013). He was with Cape Peninsula University of Technology, Wellington, South Africa (2018) and University of Limerick, Ireland (2019) as a Visiting Researcher. Prof. Uthman is a seasoned and dedicated academic with over 20 years experience as a University Lecturer and Researcher. He has supervised several undergraduate (BSc) projects numbering over 200 and 11 postgraduate theses. He has to his credit over 60 in-depth scientific articles, which are published in reputable journals (indexed in Scopus, Web of Science etc). He is a member of several scientific societies including Biochemical Society (UK), Nigerian Society for Biochemistry & Molecular Biology and Society for Medicinal Plants & Economic Development (South Africa) to mention a few. His research interests include Environmental Toxicology, Phytomedicine and Plant Biochemistry with focus on the search for antioxidants, bioherbicides and biofertilizers from natural products.

name: Dr. Judith Nkechinyere Ohanaka
bio: Dr. Judith Nkechinyere Ohanaka is currently a Lecturer I in the Department of Biochemistry and the College of Health Sciences, Nile University of Nigeria. She had her first degree in Biochemistry from Ladoke Akintola University of Technology (B.Tech.) in 2009. Her M.Sc. and Ph.D. degree (in Biochemistry) were obtained from the University of Ilorin, Nigeria in 2014 and 2019, respectively. In 2016, she was awarded a Doctoral Research Fellowship by the Organization for Women in Science for the Developing World (OWSD), Trieste, Italy tenable at the University of Free State, Bloemfontein, South Africa. She is a member of Nigeria Society of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology (NSBMB), Nigeria Society of Experimental Biology (NISEB), Organization for Women in Science for the Developing World (OWSD), Trieste, Italy. Her research interests include Clinical Biochemistry, Molecular Biology and Toxicology. Currently, her research focus is on exploring the Biochemistry of natural products for the treatment of diabetes mellitus. She is the current Staff Advisor for National Association of Biochemistry students (NABS), Nile University of Nigeria.
